^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.
This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.
This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

UefiAdminPassword.description: The value of the uefi admin password.

Date.description: Indicate the specified date for next power action, the format shoud be Month/Day/Year. By the parameter, user can set to automatically power on the server on specified day.

ResetType.description: The type of reset to be performed.
ResetType.longDescription: This defines expected power action to the system by the caller. For the method, the supported power action is 'power on server'.

Time.description: Indicate the specified time for next power action, the format is 'Hour:Minute AM/PM'.By the parameter, user can set to automatically power on the server on specified moment.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

enumDescriptions.BMC: The port is always connected to the BMC. It is never connected to the server.
enumDescriptions.Server: The port is always connected to the server. It is never connected to the BMC.

FrontPanelUSBPort.description: This object indicates the configuration of front panel USB port.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

FPMode.description: The mode configuration of the front panel USB port.
FPMode.longDescription: Display and configure the front panel USB port mode.

IDButton.description: Enable/Disable using id button to toggle owner.
IDButton.longDescription: The BMC will support a setting that allows the user to choose whether or not to allow the ID (Locate) push button to be used as a signal to the BMC to switch the port to or from the BMC. This setting is hidden if Shared FPMode is not enabled.

InactivityTimeoutMins.longDescription: The BMC will support an inactivity timeout that signals the BMC to automatically switch the USB port back from the BMC to the server when the USB port is in shared mode and server power is on and there has been no USB activity to the BMC for a period of time. This setting is hidden if Shared FPMode is not enabled for front panel USB port.

PortSwitchingTo.description: Display and configure the front panel USB port owner.
PortSwitchingTo.longDescription: If the port configuration is set to Shared FPMode and the USB port is currently connected to the server, the BMC will support a request to switch the front panel USB port to the BMC. When this request is executed, the front panel USB connector will be switched immediately to the BMC. If the port configuration is set to Shared FPMode and the USB port is currently connected to the BMC, the BMC will support a request to switch the front panel USB port back to the server. When this request is executed, the front panel USB connector will be switched immediately to the server. This setting is hidden if Shared FPMode is not enabled.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

AssertRPP.description: Get/set the BMC to assert or de-assert UEFI's remote physical presence signal.
AssertRPP.longDescription: The value of this property shall get/set the BMC to assert or de-assert UEFI's physical presence signal.This property is get/set via an IPMI command which can only be exercised by IPMI users with Administrator privileges.

EnableRPP.description: Represents the BMC's ability to assert UEFI remote physical presence.
EnableRPP.longDescription: The value of this property shall represent the BMC's ability to assert UEFI remote physical presence.

AssertDurationMins.description: Represents assert physical presence of TPM for this duration.
AssertDurationMins.longDescription: The value of this property shall represent assert physical presence of TPM for this duration.

TPMSettings.description: This object is used to represent TPM operation settings.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

AllowEnableSecureBootOverKCS.description: Get/set whether the BMC allow to enable secure boot over KCS.
AllowEnableSecureBootOverKCS.longDescription: The value of this property shall get/set whether the BMC allow to enable secure boot over KCS.

AllowDisableSecureBootOverKCS.description: Get/set whether the BMC allow to disable secure boot over KCS.
AllowDisableSecureBootOverKCS.longDescription: The value of this property shall get/set whether the BMC allow to disable secure boot over KCS.

SecureBootOverKCSSettings.description: This object is used to represent SecureBoot Over KCS settings.

LenovoSystemProperties.longDescription: This type shall contains Lenovo Oem properties of ComputerSystem.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

BootSettings.description: A refernce to the collection of the boot settings for the server.
BootSettings.longDescription: Use this field to describe the server boot settings. From the general classification, there are 3 collections. There are multiple boot sources in sequence in each collection.

FrontPanelUSB.description: The properties for the front panel USB port.
FrontPanelUSB.longDescription: The value of this property shall represent the properties for the front panel USB port.

TPMSettings.description: Represents the settings of TPM operations service.
TPMSettings.longDescription: The value of this property shall represent the settings of TPM oprations service.

SecureBootOverKCSSettings.description: Represents the setting of secure boot over KCS.
SecureBootOverKCSSettings.longDescription: The value of this property shall represent the setting of secure boot over KCS.

HistorySysPerf.description: A reference indicating system performance history metric values.
HistorySysPerf.longDescription: The value of this property shall be a reference indicating system performance history metric values. In this reference shall contain: SystemPerformance, CPUSubsystemPerformance, MemorySubsystemPerformance, IOSubsystemPerformance metric values.

Metrics.description: A reference to the collection of the system metrics in general detail.
Metrics.longDescription: The value of this property shall be a reference indicating the collection of the system metrics in general detail.

NumberOfReboots.description: NumberOfReboots indicates the number of times the system has been rebooted.
NumberOfReboots.longDescription: NumberOfReboots indicates the number of times the system has been rebooted.

ScheduledPowerActions.description: A reference to the collection of the scheduled power actions of the system.
ScheduledPowerActions.longDescription: This is a reference to scheduled power actions. This object shall contain properties which describes the scheduled power actions for the current resource.

Sensors.description: This object describes the sensors of the system in general detail.
Sensors.longDescription: This is a reference to sensor. This object shall contain properties which describes the sensors for the current resource.

SystemStatus.description: Represents the status of the system.
SystemStatus.longDescription: The value of this property shall represent the status of the system.

TotalPowerOnHours.description: The total amount of time that the host server has been powered on.
TotalPowerOnHours.longDescription: The total amount of time that the host server has been powered on.

enumDescriptions.BMC: The front panel USB port is currently connected to the BMC/Request to switch the front panel USB port to the BMC.
enumDescriptions.Server: The front panel USB port is currently connected to the server/Request to switch the front panel USB port to the server.

ResetType.description: The type of reset to be performed.
ResetType.longDescription: This defines expected power action to the system by the caller.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

title: #LenovoComputerSystem.v1_0_0
